intro: Bossiaea rhombifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Bossiaea rhombifolia is an important component of the local flora and supports various pollinators.
